member.name: P:Reimers.Map.GoogleStreetviewClient.RenderDelay
member.summary: Gets or set the delay before rendering the client on the page in milliseconds
member.remarks:
This property can be used to avoid "Operation Aborted" errors in Internet Explorer.
Increase the value if "Operation Aborted" errors appear on the page.
Decrease the value to render map quicker on the page.
Default value is 500 milliseconds.

member.name: P:Reimers.Map.GoogleStreetviewClient.PostRenderScript
member.summary: JavaScript commands to be executed after the client render script has been run.
member.remarks:
Use the PostRenderScript property to set scripts that should run after the client has successfully renders.
This property can be used to set clientside handlers or other scripts that do not need to interact with the callback server.

member.name: T:Reimers.Map.Static.GoogleStaticMap
member.summary: Renders a Google Static Map on a web page.

remarks.para: The rendered map is an image fetched from Google's Static Maps API.

example.para: The code below shows how to define a GoogleStaticMap using markup alone.
example.code: <%@ Page Language="C#" AutoEventWireup="true" CodeFile="Default.aspx.cs" Inherits="_Default" %> <%@ Register Assembly="GoogleMap" Namespace="Reimers.Map.Static" TagPrefix="Reimers" %> <%@ Register Assembly="GoogleMap" Namespace="Reimers.Map" TagPrefix="Reimers" %> <%@ Register Assembly="GoogleMap" Namespace="Reimers.Map.Controls" TagPrefix="Reimers" %> <%@ Register Assembly="GoogleMap" Namespace="Reimers.Map.CustomMaps" TagPrefix="Reimers" %> <%@ Register Assembly="GoogleMap" Namespace="Reimers.Map.Geocoding" TagPrefix="Reimers" %>

member.name: T:Reimers.Map.GooglePolyline
member.summary: Renders a line on a .

remarks.para: Maps that use or must conform to the requirements in the Google Documentation.
To ensure that and display properly in Internet Explorer the following markup must present on the page:
remarks.code:
<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Strict//EN" "http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-strict.dtd">
            <html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:v="urn:schemas-microsoft-com:vml">
            <head>
            <style type="text/css">
                v\:* {
                  behavior:url(#default#VML);
                }
            </style>
            </head>

remarks.para: The expected string format is dd.ddd,dd.ddd dd.ddd,dd.ddd dd.ddd,dd.ddd - a sequence of comma separated coordinates using dot (.) as a required decimal separator. Negative number use a minue (-) prefix.
If is set to true then the expected order is lat/lng, otherwise lng/lat.

member.name: M:Reimers.Map.GoogleMarker.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of a GoogleMarker.

example.para: The code below shows how to read marker information from a database and create the appropriate markers.
example.code:
Dim conn As New SqlConnection("Your connection string") Dim cmd As New SqlCommand("SELECT ID, Lat, Lng, Text FROM Overlays", conn)
conn.Open()
Dim dtr As SqlDataReader = cmd.ExecuteReader While dtr.Read Dim marker As New GoogleMarker marker.ID = dtr("ID").ToString marker.Latitude = CType(dtr("Lat"), Double) marker.Longitude = CType(dtr("Lng"), Double) marker.MarkerText = dtr("Text").ToString GoogleMap.Overlays.Add(marker) End While
dtr.Close()
conn.Close()

member.name: M:Reimers.Map.GoogleMarker.#ctor(System.String,Reimers.Map.GoogleLatLng)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of a GoogleMarker
member.param: The ID of the GoogleMarker.
The location of the GoogleMarker as a .

remarks.para: Creating a marker using this creates a static marker with the minimum information needed. Further data and functionallity can be added after the marker is created.

example.para: The following code sample shows how this constructor can be used when creating a marker that reads an ID and a value from a datareader.
example.code:
Dim conn As New SqlConnection("Your connection string") Dim cmd As New SqlCommand("SELECT ID, Lat, Lng, Text FROM Overlays", conn)
conn.Open()
Dim dtr As SqlDataReader = cmd.ExecuteReader While dtr.Read Dim marker As New GoogleMarker marker.ID = dtr("ID").ToString marker.Latitude = CType(dtr("Lat"), Double) marker.Longitude = CType(dtr("Lng"), Double) marker.MarkerText = dtr("Text").ToString GoogleMap.Overlays.Add(marker) End While
dtr.Close()
conn.Close()
example.para: The following example shows how to create a marker in a click event handler to place a marker on the clicked location and persist the state of the control.

member.name: T:Reimers.Map.GooglePolygon
member.summary: Renders a polygon on a .

remarks.para: Maps that use or must conform to the requirements in the Google Documentation.
To ensure that and display properly in Internet Explorer the following markup must present on the page:
remarks.code:
<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Strict//EN" "http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-strict.dtd">
            <html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:v="urn:schemas-microsoft-com:vml">
            <head>
            <style type="text/css">
                v\:* {
                  behavior:url(#default#VML);
                }
            </style>
            </head>

member.name: M:Reimers.Map.GoogleBounds.op_Multiply(Reimers.Map.GoogleBounds,System.Int32)
member.summary: Multiplies the area of the GoogleBounds with the given factor.
member.param: The GoogleBounds to mulitply with.
The factor to multiply with.
member.remarks:
This operation scales the area of the GoogleBounds by the given factor while keeping the same center.
This operation can be useful when users want to increase the bounds slightly to ensure that overlays are not displayed at map edges.

member.name: M:Reimers.Map.Accessories.MapCalculations.Distance(Reimers.Map.GoogleMarker,Reimers.Map.GoogleMarker,Reimers.Map.Units)
member.summary: Calculates the distance between 2 in the unit selected.
member.param: A .
A .
A .
member.returns: Returns a value giving the distance between the Start and Finish
member.remarks: The distance is calculated as the length of a great circle between 2 point. The distance calculation is based on the mean radius of the Earth. As such the calculation is not accurate for all points of the Earth. The distance should be used only as an indication and should never be used in navigation.

member.name: T:Reimers.Map.GoogleMap
member.summary: Renders a GoogleMap on an ASP.NET 2.0 page.

remarks.para: Maps that use or must conform to the requirements in the Google Documentation.

example.para: To render the map on the page register the assembly using the following markup.
example.code: <%@ register assembly="GoogleMap" namespace="Reimers.Map" tagprefix="Reimers" %>
example.para: Use the following markup to insert the map on the location of the page where you want it:
example.code: <Reimers:GoogleMap ID="GoogleMap1" runat="server" GoogleKey="Googlesreallylongkey" />
example.para: Further attributes can be set in the markup. Note however that properties set in the markup cannot be changed during postbacks or callbacks.
The code below shows how a GoogleMap can be defined using markup alone.
example.code: <%@ Page Language="C#" AutoEventWireup="true" CodeFile="Default.aspx.cs" Inherits="_Default" %> <%@ Register Assembly="GoogleMap" Namespace="Reimers.Map.Static" TagPrefix="Reimers" %> <%@ Register Assembly="GoogleMap" Namespace="Reimers.Map" TagPrefix="Reimers" %> <%@ Register Assembly="GoogleMap" Namespace="Reimers.Map.Controls" TagPrefix="Reimers" %> <%@ Register Assembly="GoogleMap" Namespace="Reimers.Map.CustomMaps" TagPrefix="Reimers" %> <%@ Register Assembly="GoogleMap" Namespace="Reimers.Map.Geocoding" TagPrefix="Reimers" %>
example.para: The same example using C# and VB.NET code.
example.code: Imports Reimers.Map Partial Class Default Inherits System.Web.UI.Page Protected Overrides Sub OnLoad(ByVal e As System.EventArgs) MyBase.OnLoad(e) Dim map As New GoogleMap("map") map.Options.MapTypes.Clear() map.Options.MapTypes.Add(New Reimers.Map.CustomMaps.GoogleHybridMap()) map.Options.MapTypes.Add(New Reimers.Map.CustomMaps.GoogleMarsElevationMap()) map.MapControls.Add( _ New Reimers.Map.Controls.GoogleSmallMapTypeControl( _ "smtc", New Reimers.Map.Controls.GoogleControlPosition( _ GoogleControlAnchor.G_ANCHOR_TOP_LEFT, New GoogleSize(10, 5))) _ ) map.ClientSideHandlers.OnDragEnd = "alert(this.getCenter().toUrlValue());" End Sub End Class

member.name: M:Reimers.Map.GoogleMap.GeocodeFromClient(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a JavaScript command as a that, when executed on the client, geocodes the contents of a DOM element using a clientside request.
member.param: The ID of the DOM element to fetch the address from as a .
value indicating whether the DOM element value is exposed as innerHTML.

remarks.para: This method creates a JavaScript command that must be sent to a method that executes it. Merely executing the method does not produce any results.
For textboxes (and other HTML input elements) the usesInnerHtml value should be set to false.

example.para: The following code shows how to create a command to geocode the contents of a control. Note that when using ASP.NET server buttons that by default they are set to post back the page on click. Therefore it is advisable if attaching a geocode command to a button click to use regular HTML buttons and make them server controls by adding a runat="server" attribute.
example.code: <input type="text" id="myTextbox" runat="server" /gt; <input type="button" id="btnGeocode" value="Geocode" runat="server" />
btnGeocode.Attributes.Add("onclick", GoogleMap.GeocodeFromClient("myTextbox", false));
btnGeocode.Attributes.Add("onclick", GoogleMap.GeocodeFromClient("myTextbox", False))

member.name: M:Reimers.Map.GoogleMap.ForceMapRendering
member.summary: Creates a JavaScript command that, when executed on the client, forces the map to be rendered.

remarks.para: This method creates a JavaScript command that must be sent to a method that executes it. Merely executing the method on the server does not produce any results.
This method can be used to force a redrawing of the map after an update panel has been reloaded.

Note that different browsers update the map to different states. Internet Explorer restores map to the position before the UpdatePanel initiated the callback. Mozilla redraws the map at the initial position.
It is not recommended to place a GoogleMap inside an UpdatePanel. It adds nothing to the functionality of the map. Other page areas can be placed in UpdatePanels and still interact with the map.
Use the following code in all eventhandlers triggered by the UpdatePanel to force the browser to redraw the map after the UpdatePanel has received its result from the server.

member.name: P:Reimers.Map.GoogleMap.DefaultMap
member.summary: Defines the type of map to be rendered

example.para:
The default map can be set in one of two ways. Either a reference to an existing maptype can be given, like so:
GoogleMap.DefaultMap = GoogleMap.Options.MapTypes[1];

This sets the default map to the second map type in the MapTypes collection. By default this is the satellite map, but can be changed.
Alternately a reference to a new maptype can be given, like so:
example.code: GoogleMap.DefaultMap = new GoogleSatelliteMap();

member.name: P:Reimers.Map.GoogleMap.RenderDelay
member.summary: Gets or set the delay before rendering the map on the page in milliseconds
member.remarks:
This property can be used to avoid "Operation Aborted" errors in Internet Explorer.
Increase the value if "Operation Aborted" errors appear on the page.
Decrease the value to render map quicker on the page.
Default value is 500 milliseconds.

member.name: E:Reimers.Map.GoogleMap.MapLoaded
member.summary: Triggered when the map is finished loading

remarks.para: Some map tiles map still be loading when the event triggers.

The event is triggered as a result of a asynchronous callback to the server. While this allows for event handling using serverside code, all changes to the page (either the map or other controls on the page) must be done using JavaScript commands passed to the MapCommand of the event arguments parameter.

example.para: The following code is an example of how the overlays collection can be filled with markers within the bounds of the map when it loads. The code loops through a and checks whether the coordinates held in the table are within the bounds of the map. If so they are added to the map's overlay collection and a command to render them is generated.

member.name: T:Reimers.Map.CustomMaps.KmlTileLayer
member.summary: Creates a tilelayer based on a polylines and polygons defined in a KML file.

remarks.para: The KML file to create the tile layer from must be located on a publicly accessible location defined by an absolute URL. While localhost addresses and relative URLs do not cause an no tiles will be returned.
Make sure the server on which the KML file is located serves KML files with the proper MIME type. The MIME type must be 'application/vnd.google-earth.kml+xml kml' (no quotation marks).
The tile layer creator will only render polylines and polygons. Markers and custom overlays will be ignored.

member.summary: Returns a string representation of the GoogleLatLng.
member.param: The format of the GoogleLatLng.

remarks.para:
The following is a list of valid format values:
CReturns the position as a comma separated string (lat,lng)
DReturns the position as Degrees Minutes Seconds. Ex: 51°N 30´ 00´´ 0°E 0´ 0´´
JReturns the position as a JavaScript command.
MReturns the position as a MicroFormat compatible HTML formatted sting.
UReturn the position as a URL compatible string. Values are separated by a forward slash. Ex 51.500000/0.000000

JReturns the position as a JavaScript command.

member.name: M:Reimers.Map.GoogleLatLng.Parse(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a GoogleLatLng object from a string representation.
member.param: The string representation of the position.

remarks.para: The string to parse must contain at least one set of coordinates in decimal notation using a dot (.) as decimal separator. The following is an example of a valid string for parsing as a GoogleLatLng: "51.5,0.0"
The following code sample shows how to create a GoogleLatLng from a coordinate string:

example.code: GoogleLatLng pos = GoogleLatLng.Parse("51.5,0.0");

member.name: P:Reimers.Map.GoogleMarkerOptions.ZIndexProcess
member.summary: Gets or sets the clientside function used to calculate the z-index of a marker.

remarks.para: The default ordering of markers is that southernmore markers are placed over the northernmore, in order to avoid the appearance of some markers being placed on others.

example.para: The following example sets a function that means that markers placed later in time are placed above earlier ones.
example.code: GoogleMarkersOptions myOptions = new GoogleMarkerOptions(); myOptions.ZIndexProcess = "function(marker){ return new Date().getTime(); }";
